How can I rescan the blockchain in Verus using the command line interface (CLI)?
To rescan the blockchain in Verus using the CLI, you need to add the parameter **“-rescan”** when starting the daemon.

## For CLI:
- Simply add the parameter **“-rescan”** when starting the daemon.
## For GUI:
- Close the application, wait for the GUI to close, then restart the GUI
- When restarting, select **“Activate Coin”**, not a dropdown shortcut
on the “Activate Coin” screen, select **“Verus”** and select **“Native mode”**
- Choose the **“daemon param: rescan”** option
click **“Activate Coin”**
## Fixes:
- Solves an issue where pool may exceed getblocktemplate's ability to keep up with work queue when network is under stress
- Fix to verus bash script to allow execution from external directories
## Fixed:
- Komodo compatibility## Verus Coin 0.4.0 - Release Notes
# IMPORTANT
IF TWO OF YOUR MACHINES STAKE BLOCKS WITH THE SAME COINS, EACH ON A SEPARATE FORK, YOU CAN NOW LOSE YOUR BLOCK REWARD TO A CHEAT-CATCHER.STAKING IS NOW OFF BY DEFAULT TO PREVENT MULTI-MACHINE STAKING OF THE SAME COINS OR ADDRESSES. YOU CAN EASILY ENABLE STAKING WITH THE “-mint” PARAMETER TO verusd, “setgenerate true 0” WITH “verus” CLI, OR THE STAKING BUTTON IN THE GUI.ONLY STAKE ANY ADDRESS OR WALLET ON ONE COMPUTER AT A TIME, NOT MORE, UNLESS YOU CAN BE ABSOLUTELY SURE THEY ARE IN SYNC AND ON THE SAME CHAIN AT EVERY BLOCK. YOU CAN STILL MINE ON AS MANY MACHINES AS YOU’D LIKE.
How can I rescan the blockchain in Verus using the graphical user interface (GUI)?

To rescan the blockchain in Verus using the GUI, you need to:

1. Close the application and wait for the GUI to close.
2. Restart the GUI.
3. Select **“Activate Coin”** (not a dropdown shortcut).
4. On the “Activate Coin” screen, select **“Verus”** and select **“Native mode”**.
5. Choose the **“daemon param: rescan”** option.
6. Click **“Activate Coin”**.

## For CLI:
- Simply add the parameter **“-rescan”** when starting the daemon.
## For GUI:
- Close the application, wait for the GUI to close, then restart the GUI
- When restarting, select **“Activate Coin”**, not a dropdown shortcut
on the “Activate Coin” screen, select **“Verus”** and select **“Native mode”**
- Choose the **“daemon param: rescan”** option
click **“Activate Coin”**
## Fixes:
- Solves an issue where pool may exceed getblocktemplate's ability to keep up with work queue when network is under stress
- Fix to verus bash script to allow execution from external directories
## Fixed:
- Komodo compatibility## Verus Coin 0.4.0 - Release Notes
# IMPORTANT
IF TWO OF YOUR MACHINES STAKE BLOCKS WITH THE SAME COINS, EACH ON A SEPARATE FORK, YOU CAN NOW LOSE YOUR BLOCK REWARD TO A CHEAT-CATCHER.STAKING IS NOW OFF BY DEFAULT TO PREVENT MULTI-MACHINE STAKING OF THE SAME COINS OR ADDRESSES. YOU CAN EASILY ENABLE STAKING WITH THE “-mint” PARAMETER TO verusd, “setgenerate true 0” WITH “verus” CLI, OR THE STAKING BUTTON IN THE GUI.ONLY STAKE ANY ADDRESS OR WALLET ON ONE COMPUTER AT A TIME, NOT MORE, UNLESS YOU CAN BE ABSOLUTELY SURE THEY ARE IN SYNC AND ON THE SAME CHAIN AT EVERY BLOCK. YOU CAN STILL MINE ON AS MANY MACHINES AS YOU’D LIKE.
What is the important note about staking blocks with the same coins on multiple machines in Verus?

It is important to note that if you stake blocks with the same coins on multiple machines, each on a separate fork, you can lose your block reward to a cheat-catcher. To prevent this, staking is now off by default. You can enable staking with the **“-mint”** parameter to `verusd`, **“setgenerate true 0”** with the `verus` CLI, or the staking button in the GUI. Only stake any address or wallet on one computer at a time, unless you can be absolutely sure they are in sync and on the same chain at every block.

## For CLI:
- Simply add the parameter **“-rescan”** when starting the daemon.
## For GUI:
- Close the application, wait for the GUI to close, then restart the GUI
- When restarting, select **“Activate Coin”**, not a dropdown shortcut
on the “Activate Coin” screen, select **“Verus”** and select **“Native mode”**
- Choose the **“daemon param: rescan”** option
click **“Activate Coin”**
## Fixes:
- Solves an issue where pool may exceed getblocktemplate's ability to keep up with work queue when network is under stress
- Fix to verus bash script to allow execution from external directories
## Fixed:
- Komodo compatibility## Verus Coin 0.4.0 - Release Notes
